channel.title: DTO
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from DTO, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dozen states sue Trump in bid to block new tariffs
item.description: The lawsuit in the U.S. Court of International Trade argues that Trump cannot use the International Emergency Economic Powers Act to impose tariffs.

item.title: Tariff ‘front running’ bolstered durable-goods orders last month
Why Treasury chief Bessent’s invitation-only JPMorgan talk was so controversial
Trump tells Putin to 'STOP!' Russian strikes on Kyiv
item.description: Trump's message to Vladimir Putin came a day after the American president said he believed that "Russia is ready" for a peace deal with Ukraine.

item.title: Merck says it’s folded $200 million in tariff costs into its full-year outlook
U.S. experiences sharpest monthly decline in existing-home sales since 2022
U.S. first-time claims for unemployment benefits edge upward
Confidence in Trump's handling of the U.S. economy plummets, new polls show
item.description: Americans' views of President Donald Trump's ability to handle the economy gave him an edge during the 2024 presidential election.

item.title: Treasury Secretary Bessent calls out China, World Bank, IMF in speech on global economy
item.description: "China needs to change," Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told the Institute of International Finance in Washington, D.C.

item.title: Treasury Sec. Bessent says China, U.S. have 'opportunity for a big deal' on trade
item.description: Bessent named-checked Bridgewater founder Ray Dalio, who recently expressed fears of a sharp fallout from President Donald Trump's tariff policies.
